result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad Lee Edwards was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with 22CF106, but consecutive to any other sentence currently serving. Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program, but not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.

superMiscConds.notes: DOC Collect.  If discharged from extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Activity: Plea/sentencing hearing 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

11:13 AM Defendant Chad Lee Edwards in court in person and in custody with attorney C. James Fitzgerald in person.  Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads guilty to count 2. Court finds the defendant guilty on count 2. Count 1 is dismissed and read in. Presentence investigation waived. Court orders 1 year prison and 3 years extended supervision concurrent with 22CF106, but consecutive to any other sentence currently serving. Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program, but not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. Costs DOC collect. Sentence credit 37 days.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Activity: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

8:36 AM Defendant Chad Lee Edwards in court in person and in custody with attorney C. James Fitzgerald in person. Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Benjamin Belmontes of Beloit Police Department sworn testimony taken in person; Witness identified the defendant. State moves for bind over, defense objects. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Defendant's attorney stands mute, not guilty plea entered by Court, jury trial to be set.
Preliminary hearing on February 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
